intro: Linaria concolor, commonly known as the common toadflax, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces bright yellow, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and slightly hairy, with a bluish-green hue. Linaria concolor is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
